snippet: The State Supreme Court cleared the way today for the possible closing of all medical marijuana clubs in California as it left intact a lower court's  ruling that the clubs could not sell the drug, despite a 1996 voter initiative.    The court una...
lead_paragraph: The State Supreme Court cleared the way today for the possible closing of all medical marijuana clubs in California as it left intact a lower court's ruling that the clubs could not sell the drug, despite a 1996 voter initiative. The court unanimously denied review of an appellate decision, issued last December, that said the ballot measure, Proposition 215, did not allow anyone to sell marijuana and did not allow a commercial enterprise to furnish marijuana as a ''primary care giver.''
abstract: California Supreme Court clears way for possible closing of all medical marijuana clubs in California as it leaves intact lower court's ruling that clubs cannot sell drug, despite 1996 voter initiative (M)

headline.main: Court Rejects the Sale of Medical Marijuana
